item.title: The part where he kills you
item.description: A 3D animation with a giant robot.

item.title: Sprich
item.description: Sprich (German: speak) is a tool for game developers. It allows you to easily create complex dialogs for NPCs by compiling a simple, human readable text file into JSON you can use in your game.

item.title: Trash Belt
item.description: Fly through space and try not to crash! A game for Android where your goal is to collect coins. I used Unity a lot for prototyping smaller games, but always wanted to try Godot. This game is the result of me playing around with it over the course of a weekend. I made most of this game over the course of a weekend and added more features over time.

item.title: Ubervotebot
item.description:
A Telegram bot to create polls with. Thousands of people love it.

The results can be shown in a number of different ways, see the screenshots for a preview of how it might look.

item.title: Minecraft Armorstand
item.description:
The armorstand helper allows you to focus on designing an armorstand’s pose, without messing with any code.

This tool was originally written for Minecraft 1.8, but has been updated since then to support all different versions of Minecraft.

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Lars and I am a software developer from northern Germany. After studying computer science for over six years I now work as a software developer for worldiety. I’m fascinated by technology, love programming and try to get into CGI. Check the links above to find ways to contact me, if you have any questions about projects I’m working on.

item.title: Not Found
item.description: The page you are looking for could not be found. Maybe you can find it on the home page?
